Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery grooved vessel, the fabric is partly reddish in section, the interior bears faint traces of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and is elaborated with three parallel lines of cord-marked decoration.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394708) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394708)
